ygData.subject: Re: Silk Armor & Cured Silk Armor (Recommended Skill Level)
ygData.msgSnippet: I can only really answer number 4, as I m not a tailor at all.  A good place to hunt for silk at level 11 is everfrost peaks (on the plains area), be looking
ygData.messageBody:
I can only really answer number 4, as I'm not a tailor at all. A good place
to hunt for silk at level 11 is everfrost peaks (on the plains area), be
looking for Giant and Large wooly spiders. They should all be blue and even
fights to you, so unless you bring a healer, expect some downtime between
battles. They also poison, but it's not that bad of poison. Or you could
hunt in West Karanas. The giant spiders are far between (as is everything
in that gigantic zone), but it's fairly good hunting. Oh, and for hunting
spiders now a days, I recommend doing it off prime time hours, as every is
looking for spider silks now, and we monks can't out pull the thousands of
spellcasters out there that see a spider and burn it from a mile off.
----- Original Message -----
From: Terence Tan Kar Chuan <karchuan@...>
To: <EQ_Monk@onelist.com>; <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 21, 1999 7:47 PM
Subject: [EQ-Monks] Silk Armor & Cured Silk Armor (Recommended Skill Level)


> From: "Terence Tan Kar Chuan" <karchuan@...>
>
> 1. What is the recommended skill level before I could make "Silk Armor"
> at a reasonable rate?
>
> 2. What is the recommended skill level before I could make "Cured Silk
> Armor" at a reasonable rate?
>
> 3. What is the easiest part (cap, gorget, tunic, leggings, belt, cloak
> etc...) to make for each type of armor? Can anyone list them down in order
> of difficulties?
>
> 4. Where can I get a constant supply of spider silk near Qeynos area? I
> am only level 11 so I cannot go to E.Karana.
>
> Level 11 Qeynos Monk
> Errollisi Marr
>
>
> >
